name: Big Mountain Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed here one night after a long day at Glacier. The hotel is a 3 star at best. Clean, big rooms, although we were annoyed that we booked a "one bedroom suite" with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch and it was only one big room without any type of divider. The couch was right in front of the TV too so it made it hard for the kids to sleep and watch TV at the same time. (We asked about the 1-bedroom suite and the front desk said that was only for the king bed and sofa sleeper so I guess their website is a bit misleading?). The pool has a waterslide but it dumps into 5 feet of water so unless your kid can swim or you have a very tall adult to catch them, it it unusable for littler kids. The pool is also 3.5 feet deep at the shallowest end. The hot tub is actually outside so we didn't use that since it was pretty chilly in the morning. Breakfast was the run-of-the-mill continental breakfast w/ some hot items available. Decent hotel but I would probably find a place with a more kid-friendly pool when we return next summer.
reviews.title: Okay hotel, pool for older kids/adults

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for nearly a week when we hiked Glacier National Park. OK, so it wasn't the Ritz but it was PERFECT for what we needed. The room was clean, comfortable, and affordable. The staff was super nice, and the location was just what we needed. They have a pool and internet access to print out your boarding passes. They are close to restaurants and don't miss the Whitefish Farmer's Market during the week -- either Tuesday or Wednesday nights. It is so worth it.
reviews.title: Close to Glacier NP.

reviews.text: This motel was just fine for what we needed it for. We were visiting Glacier Park, and it was not really close, but we knew that when we booked. The service was good. Front desk was very helpful. Rooms were clean and very large - almost too large, in fact. Bathroom sink was clogged and they fixed it as soon as we reported it. Our room was described as a bedroom and sitting room which was a bit misleading since it was just one big room. It had a fridge and microwave and buffet continental breakfast was included. In addition to the normal rolls and cereals, they had sausage and eggs or biscuits and gravy.
reviews.title: It was fine for the purpose

reviews.text: Loved the pool area. They also have a hot tub and a water slide... the kids loved it.
reviews.title: Nice place for families

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and they serve a much more wholesome breakfast than most other hotels I've visited. For e.g. they had a couple different egg dishes, warm sausages etc in addition to the usual continental fare.
reviews.title: Dirty, poor value, gets booked when the others fill up

reviews.text: I was not expecting much when we arrived at this hotel but what a pleasant surprise to find
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: a big, clean, well lit room with great bath. We were on the 1st floor so we had an additional
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: outside entrance (big help with all our stuff). The hotel is located just outside of downtown so a car is required to visit the shopping areas. It has this wonderful pool area and free breakfast. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Could not wait to get back & write a review.
reviews.title: Nothing to shout about

reviews.text: We almost didn't stay here based on the reviews, but decided to ignore them. Glad we did!!! The staff is SUPER friendly and helpful. The hotel is nice with a good breakfast in the morning. The location is good, with several restaurants within walking distance. Finally, if you have kids, they will LOVE the pool. The water slide in the pictures is even more fun in real life. It also accomodates adults. I would stay here anytime!!!
reviews.title: Clean and friendly stuff, but not as advertised.

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as a stop over on our way to another destination.
reviews.title: Room is so bad and over price!!

reviews.text: Family of five stayed here during our visit to Glacier NP. We opted for a room with a fold out sofa and it had plenty of room which was nice. It was fairly clean but not exceptional. Beds were not comfortable. The breakfast was not good either. The pool has a water slide which my kids really enjoyed but it was too far to walk into Whitefish for dinner and it's location is behind other buildings so it was hard to find.
reviews.title: Not the best choice in this area

reviews.text: If I return I will definitely stay at a different place that's in downtown Whitefish. This is a 30 minute drive from the park, but if I couldn't stay in the park I would still stay in Whitefish because of it's cute, fun downtown area with shopping & restaurants. That was a nice break after the park.
reviews.title: Below expectations

reviews.text: Myself and a friend were traveling on motorcycles thru Glacier. The property is not biker friendly. The front desk person denied us our request to park our bikes under the entrance canopy and was not very friendly. In eight years of traveling by motorcycles this is the first time this request was denied. The room was large but rather dirty. The bathroom was dirty with hair and smelled of urine. They have 2 outdoor hot tubs however one was out of service and the working one was cold. The deluxe breakfast was ok with some fruit, breads and either eggs and bacon or biscuits and gravy. I would not stay at this property again.
reviews.title: Stay away from Big Mountain Lodge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Choices are limited in Whitefish but do your best to stay somewhere else. Their website reservation system didn't work, but fortunately they had a room for me. They should shut down that feature on the website until it gets fixed! Also, rooms are minimally cleaned - the floors were dirty and the place is aged. Also, the doors don't work properly. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. This place is aggravating!
reviews.title: a bit too pricey for what it has offered.

reviews.text: If you are visiting Glacier NP, don't stay at this hotel. It's quit far away from the park.
reviews.title: So-so hotel
Good hotel
reviews.text: Nice hotel to stay at. Good location, close to restrauants. Good continental breakfast. Nice staff.

I stayed at the Big Mountain Lodge to attend a wedding in Whitefish. The staff was helpful, the rooms were a bit dated, parking tight, but the location was great. Near food places for the kids, a short drive/long walk into downtown. The only problem we had was each day we had to get new keys. The hotel staff told us we must be putting them near the cell phone etc. Just to check, we left a working key in the car when we left for the day, upon our return the key didn't work.
reviews.title: Great location for Whitefish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here many times over the past few years, and this past stay was the worst.
reviews.title: Gone downhill lately...

reviews.text: This motel was previously a Holiday Inn Express, then changed owners/ names but is currently is in desperate need of remodel.
reviews.title: Good value for the money!

reviews.text: The plumbing is very noisy. Our toilet worked intermittently, and the bath/ shower faucets were so loose that they moved around inside of the wall. The carpets were worn, the TV remote didn't work and the clock was a half-hour off and couldn't be set. We could hear the guests in their rooms all around us, even though they weren't overly loud. The second door (to the exterior) couldn't be locked without a lot of effort. There was an open box of condoms in the nightstand drawer.
reviews.title: Family swim, hot tub, breakfast, ski hotel

description: The Big Mountain Express Whitefish Hotel is a 100% non-smoking hotel. Whitefish, Montana is the perfect vacation destination for your visit to Glacier National Park or Big Mountain Ski Resort. For the family, we have our indoor pool with a 90 ft. water slide, two outdoor hot tubs, and a variety of restaurants within walking distance. To make sure that the whole family is complete, don t forget a loved one; be sure to bring the family pet along as we are a pet friendly hotel. Free high-speed internet access in all guest rooms (DSL and wireless internet access). Also, a business computer in the lobby with access to printers, copier, and fax. Generous breakfast bar with, fresh fruit, bagels, yogurt and lots more!**Water Slide will be removed as of September 15, 2012***
